title: How do I bind JSON data to my class property
body:
First of all if your WeatherItem are just model of your backend class it should look like this (model class should have same property names as json):

export class WeatherItem {
  constructor(weather: Weather,
              base: string,
              id: number,
              name: string,
              cod: number) {}
}

export class Weather {
    constructor(id: number,
                main: string,
                description: string,
                icon: string){}
}

Second one, your weatherItems should be declared like that:

public weatherItems: Array<WeatherItem>; // or just weatherItem: Weather if your json just return single object

Of course you can create full model with rest of your json properties (main, wind, rain ect), but its not needed if you dont need to use it.
